title: Ukraine hails first territory recaptured in counteroffensive
description: 'First results' of counterattack praised as Ukraine troops claim to take back villages in the eastern Donetsk region.

title: What does Donald Trump’s indictment mean for democracy?
description: Former president is the first US leader to face federal charges.

title: Wagner mercenary boss brushes off Russian order to sign contracts
description: Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu gave the directive saying all 'volunteer detachments' must now sign military contracts.

title: British tourists missing after boat fire in Egypt’s Red Sea
description: Egyptian authorities say an electrical short circuit sparked a blaze on a scuba diving boat near Marsa Alam.

title: Djokovic wins record 23rd men’s Grand Slam with third French Open
description: Djokovic dispatches Casper Ruud in straight sets to break record for most major singles trophies in men's tennis.

title: Scotland’s ex-leader Nicola Sturgeon arrested in finance probe
description: Sturgeon was arrested in connection with a police investigation into the Scottish National Party's funding.

title: EU offers Tunisia aid package, seeks tighter border control
description: The EU is considering a major financial package for the cash-strapped nation amid a growing refugee and migrant crisis.

title: Part of major US highway collapses after fire in Philadelphia
description: Video shows a massive concrete slab covering an entire section of the northbound lanes on Interstate 95.

title: Taliban slams UN report calling Afghan government ‘exclusionary’
description: Condemnation comes after UN Security Council report said there were rifts within the Taliban's ranks.

title: The West has lost the plot in the Balkans
description: The recent escalation in Kosovo reflects the US and the EU's dangerous strategy of appeasing expansionist Belgrade.

title: Magnitude 6.2 earthquake shakes northern Japan
description: The earthquake affected the northern island of Hokkaido but no injuries or significant damage have been reported.

title: Australia beat India to win cricket World Test Championship
description: Victory by 209 runs at The Oval means Australia capture the one major men's cricket title that had eluded them.

title: Nuclear bomb fears are a false ‘excuse’: Iran’s Khamenei
description: Iranian leader said some international stakeholders cannot be trusted, but that cooperation with IAEA must continue.

title: Honduras opens embassy in China after cutting ties with Taiwan
description: Honduras established formal ties with China in March, becoming the latest country to break ties with Taiwan.

title: ‘Most fearless’ fighting in Sudan after 24-hour ceasefire ends
description: While Saturday marked the calmest day since the conflict began, fighting resumed on Sunday with renewed intensity.

title: Colombia Indigenous children survived 40 days eating seeds, roots
description: Four children were discovered by a team of army and Indigenous people after their plane crashed in the Amazon jungle.

title: Taiwan scrambles air force as Chinese warplanes cross median line
description: Ten Chinese aircraft flew over the Taiwan Strait's median line on Sunday as tensions in the region continue to rise.

title: White rhinos reintroduced to DR Congo national park
description: Sixteen rhinos released into Garamba National Park more than 16 years after last one was poached in the reserve.

title: Romania recalls Kenya envoy for ‘calling Africans monkeys’
description: Dragos Viorel Tigau allegedly compared a monkey with Africans while attending a meeting in Nairobi.

title: Montenegro holds key snap parliamentary vote
description: Voters in the Western Balkan nation will elect members to 81-seat parliament in a snap election.

title: Trump calls indictment ‘baseless’ as he hits campaign trail
description: Former US president blasts federal indictment as 'a political hit job' as he rallies support at Republican conventions.

title: Indian wrestler accuses gov’t of silence over sexual abuse probe
description: Vinesh Phogat, who has accused wrestling body chief of sexually abusing her, has slammed pace of probe into allegations.

title: China has been spying from Cuba for years, says US official
description: Havana slams 'slanderous speculation' as US official says China upgraded its intelligence unit in Cuba in 2019.

title: Egypt toughens visa rules for Sudanese nationals fleeing war
description: Cairo says all Sudanese must obtain visas before crossing the border, reversing an exemption for women and children.

title: Israelis rally against judicial changes, Palestinian crime deaths
description: Protesters take to streets for the 23rd week, opposing judicial changes as well as killings of Palestinians in Israel.

title: Zelenskyy says counteroffensive actions under way against Russia
description: Ukraine's leader tells Russian President Vladimir Putin that his generals are optimistic about the military operations.
